vi@v-os.ca

Nakade is a realtime point-cloud audiovisual demo.

The video above has a very high bitrate. If you're having trouble loading it, please check out the compressed video on Vimeo.

Nakade was created for Synchrony 2020 in an 11-hour train ride from New York to Montreal, winning first place in the Demo category.

The project was created in collaboration with Léa Demeule, who took the role of graphics programmer for point cloud rendering, point cloud manipulation, post processing effects, and scene management.

All environments in this demo were made using photogrammetry of locations in New York and the train the jam took place in.

Victor Ivanov
